Disabled mum

georgiea Member Posts: 6 Listener
February 15 edited March 4 in Disabled parents
Hi I've come to the point now I'm going to have to use a wheelchair but have a bit of a dilemma! 
I'm a mum to an 18 month old who doesnt yet walk. How do you other disabled wheelchair user mums get around with your little ones without having to have another adult with you ?? 

I would really appreciate your help, thank you !! 

2 · Share on TwitterShare on Facebook

Replies

  • janer1967 Community champion Posts: 1,138 Pioneering
    February 15
    @Georgie Hello and welcome to the community, I am a community champion here at scope. I am a disabled mum too but fortunately my son is a teenager so I don't have your issue. Take a look at our disabled parents section there may be some advice on there. I don't know if its harder that he/she doesn't walk or when they can and your having to folow them everywhere. i hope sopme of our members can assist with your queryl  
    1 · Share on TwitterShare on Facebook
  • georgiea Member Posts: 6 Listener
    February 15
    Thankyou, I'll definitely have a look 
    0 · Share on TwitterShare on Facebook
  • Ails Community champion Posts: 2,268 Disability Gamechanger
    February 20
    Hi @georgiea and welcome to the Community.  It is nice to meet you and thank you for sharing with us.  I'm not a mum myself so am unable to help you, sorry, but as @janer1967 says, please have a look at the disabled parents section of the forum for further help as I am sure someone will be able to best advise you there.  Wishing you well anyway and if there is anything we can help/support you with then please just let us know. 
    Winner of the Scope New Volunteer Award 2019.  
    1 · Share on TwitterShare on Facebook
  • Chloe_Scope Administrator Posts: 8,546 Scope community team
    February 20
    Welcome to the community @georgiea! Have you heard of baby-wearing?

    This is something that @WhenTaniaTalks does and she has been amazing about raising awareness about it.

    Here is her blog and her instagram that you might find helpful.
    Community Partner
    Scope
    1 · Share on TwitterShare on Facebook
  • georgiea Member Posts: 6 Listener
    February 20
    @Chloe_Scope thankyou very very I'll definitely have a read!  
    1 · Share on TwitterShare on Facebook
  • georgiea Member Posts: 6 Listener
    February 20
    @Ails thankyou nice to meet you all too, I'll bear that in mind 
    1 · Share on TwitterShare on Facebook
  • Chloe_Scope Administrator Posts: 8,546 Scope community team
    March 4
    Hi @georgiea, how are you getting on?
    Community Partner
    Scope
    1 · Share on TwitterShare on Facebook
  • laura222 Member Posts: 73 Pioneering
    March 4
    Hi @georgiea!

    This is something I think about a lot too and have found some great support from amazing, creative people living with similar challenges in a Facebook group. It's wonderful to see real-life examples of how other people do these things! I'd definitely recommend joining if you use Facebook https://www.facebook.com/groups/378499872939885/
    1 · Share on TwitterShare on Facebook
  • georgiea Member Posts: 6 Listener
    March 4
    @Chloe_Scope I haven't managed to get a baby sling or carrier or a wheelchair or mobility scooter as of yet but have done a lot of reading as you suggest and it definitely comforts me to know that there are other people in my situation who are finding solutions  
    0 · Share on TwitterShare on Facebook
  • georgiea Member Posts: 6 Listener
    March 4
    Hi @laura222

    Thankyou that's amazing! I have requested to join  
    1 · Share on TwitterShare on Facebook
  • Chloe_Scope Administrator Posts: 8,546 Scope community team
    March 9
    georgiea said:
    @Chloe_Scope I haven't managed to get a baby sling or carrier or a wheelchair or mobility scooter as of yet but have done a lot of reading as you suggest and it definitely comforts me to know that there are other people in my situation who are finding solutions  
    I'm glad the research has helped @georgiea! Please do let us know how you get on.
    Community Partner
    Scope
    0 · Share on TwitterShare on Facebook

Fancy a chat in our virtual coffee lounge?

Put the kettle on and have a chat in our coffee lounge with other members. We talk about hobbies, games and anything else you can think of!

Our shops are starting to reopen

We urgently need to generate 150,000 bags of donated stock. If you're having a clear out, save it for Scope!

Information about COVID-19

If you have questions about the virus, please read our information and support which includes guidance on benefits, getting food and essentials and Cerebral Palsy.

Tell us what you think?

Complete our feedback form to help us to improve your community.

Carers, how are you?

With the pandemic, more people than ever have unpaid care responsibilities. During Carers Week we are asking people to share advice and support.

Gardening in lockdown

The community are sharing their gardens or house plants and benefits that gardening can have.

Free disability helpline

Open Monday to Friday 8am to 8pm. Saturday to Sunday 10am to 6pm.

  • Phone
    0808 800 3333
  • Email
    [email protected]

post_text.surface_form: Hi I've come to the point now I'm going to have to use a wheelchair but have a bit of a dilemma! I'm a mum to an 18 month old who doesnt yet walk. How do you other disabled wheelchair user mums get around with your little ones without having to have another adult with you ?? I would really appreciate your help, thank you !!

@Georgie Hello and welcome to the community, I am a community champion here at scope. I am a disabled mum too but fortunately my son is a teenager so I don't have your issue. Take a look at our disabled parents section there may be some advice on there. I don't know if its harder that he/she doesn't walk or when they can and your having to folow them everywhere. i hope sopme of our members can assist with your queryl
Thankyou, I'll definitely have a look

Hi @georgiea and welcome to the Community. It is nice to meet you and thank you for sharing with us. I'm not a mum myself so am unable to help you, sorry, but as @janer1967 says, please have a look at the disabled parents section of the forum for further help as I am sure someone will be able to best advise you there. Wishing you well anyway and if there is anything we can help/support you with then please just let us know.

Welcome to the community @georgiea! Have you heard of baby-wearing? This is something that @WhenTaniaTalks does and she has been amazing about raising awareness about it. Here is her blog and her instagram that you might find helpful.
@Chloe_Scope thankyou very very I'll definitely have a read!
@Ails thankyou nice to meet you all too, I'll bear that in mind
Hi @georgiea, how are you getting on?

Hi @georgiea! This is something I think about a lot too and have found some great support from amazing, creative people living with similar challenges in a Facebook group. It's wonderful to see real-life examples of how other people do these things! I'd definitely recommend joining if you use Facebook https://www.facebook.com/groups/378499872939885/

@Chloe_Scope I haven't managed to get a baby sling or carrier or a wheelchair or mobility scooter as of yet but have done a lot of reading as you suggest and it definitely comforts me to know that there are other people in my situation who are finding solutions
Hi @laura222 Thankyou that's amazing! I have requested to join

georgiea said: @Chloe_Scope I haven't managed to get a baby sling or carrier or a wheelchair or mobility scooter as of yet but have done a lot of reading as you suggest and it definitely comforts me to know that there are other people in my situation who are finding solutions I'm glad the research has helped @georgiea! Please do let us know how you get on.
